materials.raw_text: Co: 160 g, Fe: 20 g, Mn: 20 g, Nd: 40 g, P: 120 g

sourcing.instructions: Co (Cobalt): Available from chemical supply companies or online marketplaces. Fe (Iron): Obtain from local hardware stores or metal suppliers. Mn (Manganese): Purchase from chemical suppliers. Nd (Neodymium): Sourced from specialized rare earth material suppliers. P (Phosphorus): Find at chemical supply stores.
steps: Co (Cobalt): Available from chemical supply companies or online marketplaces. Fe (Iron): Obtain from local hardware stores or metal suppliers. Mn (Manganese): Purchase from chemical suppliers. Nd (Neodymium): Sourced from specialized rare earth material suppliers. P (Phosphorus): Find at chemical supply stores.

1. Measure each ingredient using an analytical balance for accuracy. 2. In a clean, dry container, combine 160 g of Co, 20 g of Fe, 20 g of Mn, 40 g of Nd, and 120 g of P. 3. Mix the powders thoroughly using a mechanical mixer or mortar and pestle until homogeneous.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Measure each ingredient using an analytical balance for accuracy. 2. In a clean, dry container, combine 160 g of Co, 20 g of Fe, 20 g of Mn, 40 g of Nd, and 120 g of P. 3. Mix the powders thoroughly using a mechanical mixer or mortar and pestle until homogeneous.

steps: 1. Transfer the mixed powder to a suitable crucible. 2. Place the crucible in a muffle furnace. 3. Heat to 1000째C at a rate of 10째C/min and hold for 2 hours to ensure complete reaction and sintering.
heating.raw_text: 1. Transfer the mixed powder to a suitable crucible. 2. Place the crucible in a muffle furnace. 3. Heat to 1000째C at a rate of 10째C/min and hold for 2 hours to ensure complete reaction and sintering.

steps: 1. After the heating duration, turn off the furnace and allow it to cool down to room temperature naturally (approximately 4-6 hours). 2. Do not open the furnace until it has cooled completely to avoid thermal shock.
cooling.raw_text: 1. After the heating duration, turn off the furnace and allow it to cool down to room temperature naturally (approximately 4-6 hours). 2. Do not open the furnace until it has cooled completely to avoid thermal shock.

steps: 1. Remove the solid sample from the crucible carefully. 2. Grind the sample to achieve a smooth surface, if necessary, using a fine-grit sandpaper. 3. Optionally, seal the surface with a protective coating to enhance durability.
post_processing.raw_text: 1. Remove the solid sample from the crucible carefully. 2. Grind the sample to achieve a smooth surface, if necessary, using a fine-grit sandpaper. 3. Optionally, seal the surface with a protective coating to enhance durability.
